direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are part of the iteration process and depend on the state of the current iterator.
Both methods handle exceptions related to the state of the iterator and the underlying collection.
The hasNext method relies on updateCurrentIterator to determine if there are more elements in the iteration.
Both methods involve finding the next element in the iteration, with similar control flows and recursive logic.
Both methods involve recursive iteration and handling of nested iterators, with similar control flows.
